overview:
As a high school senior back in 2000, Kristopher Chavez founded the world’s first athletic recruiting social networking site he then named WOWrecruits.com. He later changed the name to Recruits.com in 2002 after purchasing the domain with proceeds from his lucrative technology contracts with the State of Colorado and the founding of his banner company Chavez Industries, Inc.

In June of 2007 Chavez founded TSR, a fractional vacation acquisition company. After growing the company to eight figure revenues and 40+ employees in less than twelve months he took his leave from the company in July 2009 to focus on his other technology and real estate projects while the company continues to transfer contracts for clients.

In 2008 Chavez executive produced his first feature film “Passing Buck” which was an official submission to Sundance Film Festival.

Chavez is now heavily involved as the President and CEO of his athletic recruiting company Recruits.com.
